definitions.definition: Beneath ; below ; at or to the bottom of, or the area covered or surmounted by.
examples: We found some shade under a tree.
Quick, stuff the cash under the mattress!
There is nothing new under the sun.
There is an oil leak under the car.

definitions.definition: From one side of to the other, passing beneath.
examples: There is a tunnel under the English Channel.
We can get there in under an hour.
I can't live under these circumstances.

subdefinitions.definition: Subordinate to; subject to the control of; in accordance with; in compliance with.
examples: He served in World War II under General Omar Bradley.
During the pandemic, we had to live under severe restrictions.
Under the law and concession agreement with other parties, the private company must pay taxes in time and on a right amount.

definitions.definition: Within the category, classification or heading of.
In the face of; in response to (some attacking force).
examples: to collapse under stress; to give in under interrogation

definitions.definition: Using or adopting (a name, identity, etc.).
examples: He writes books under the name John Smith.
She now lives under a new identity.

main_definition: Beneath ; below ; at or to the bottom of, or the area covered or surmounted by.
secondary_definitions: From one side of to the other, passing beneath.
Within the category, classification or heading of.
( figuratively ) In the face of; in response to (some attacking force).
Using or adopting (a name, identity, etc.).
